org.strongback.drive

Class MecanumDrive

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.strongback.drive.MecanumDrive
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Requirable, Stoppable

    @Experimental
public class MecanumDrive
extends Object
implements Stoppable, Requirable
    Control logic for a mecanum drive system. This controller provides cartesian and polar inputs.

    This drive train will work for these configurations:

    • Mecanum - 4 mecanum wheels on the four corners of the robot; or
    • Holonomic - 4 omni wheels arranged so that the front and back wheels are toed in 45 degrees, which form an X across the robot when viewed from above.

    This drive implements Requirable so that Commands can use it directly when executing. It is also designed to be driven by joystick axes.

    NOTE: This class is experimental and needs to be thoroughly tested and debugged using actual hardware.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MecanumDrive

        public MecanumDrive(Motor leftFront,
                    Motor leftRear,
                    Motor rightFront,
                    Motor rightRear,
                    AngleSensor gyro)
        Creates a new DriveSystem subsystem that uses the supplied drive train and no shifter. The voltage send to the drive train is limited to [-1.0,1.0].
        Parameters:
        leftFront - the left front motor on the drive train for the robot; may not be null
        leftRear - the left rear motor on the drive train for the robot; may not be null
        rightFront - the right front motor on the drive train for the robot; may not be null
        rightRear - the right rear motor on the drive train for the robot; may not be null
        gyro - the gyroscope that will be used to determine the robot's direction for field-orientated controls; may not be null

      • MecanumDrive

        public MecanumDrive(Motor leftFront,
                    Motor leftRear,
                    Motor rightFront,
                    Motor rightRear,
                    AngleSensor gyro,
                    DoubleToDoubleFunction speedLimiter)
        Creates a new DriveSystem subsystem that uses the supplied drive train and optional shifter. The voltage send to the drive train is limited by the given function.
        Parameters:
        leftFront - the left front motor on the drive train for the robot; may not be null
        leftRear - the left rear motor on the drive train for the robot; may not be null
        rightFront - the right front motor on the drive train for the robot; may not be null
        rightRear - the right rear motor on the drive train for the robot; may not be null
        gyro - the gyroscope that will be used to determine the robot's direction for field-orientated controls; may not be null
        speedLimiter - the function that limits the speed sent to the drive train; if null, then a default clamping function is used to limit to the range [-1.0,1.0]

    • Method Detail

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stop the drive train. This sets all motors to 0.
        Specified by:
        stop in interface Stoppable

      • cartesian

        public void cartesian(double x,
                      double y,
                      double rotation)
        Cartesian drive method that specifies speeds in terms of the field longitudinal and lateral directions, using the drive's angle sensor to automatically determine the robot's orientation relative to the field.

        Using this method, the robot will move away from the drivers when the joystick is pushed forwards, and towards the drivers when it is pulled towards them - regardless of what direction the robot is facing.

        Parameters:
        x - The speed that the robot should drive in the X direction. [-1.0..1.0]
        y - The speed that the robot should drive in the Y direction. This input is inverted to match the forward == -1.0 that joysticks produce. [-1.0..1.0]
        rotation - The rate of rotation for the robot that is completely independent of the translation. [-1.0..1.0]

      • polar

        public void polar(double magnitude,
                  double direction,
                  double rotation)
        Polar drive method that specifies speeds in terms of magnitude and direction. This method does not use the drive's angle sensor.
        Parameters:
        magnitude - The speed that the robot should drive in a given direction.
        direction - The direction the robot should drive in degrees. The direction and magnitude are independent of the rotation rate.
        rotation - The rate of rotation for the robot that is completely independent of the magnitude or direction. [-1.0..1.0]

      • normalize

        protected static void normalize(double[] wheelSpeeds)
        Normalize all wheel speeds if the magnitude of any wheel is greater than 1.0.
        Parameters:
        wheelSpeeds - the speed of each motor

      • scale

        protected static void scale(double[] wheelSpeeds,
                            double scaleFactor)
        Scale all speeds.
        Parameters:
        wheelSpeeds - the speed of each motor
        scaleFactor - the scale factor to apply to the motor speeds

      • rotateVector

        protected static double[] rotateVector(double x,
                                       double y,
                                       double angle)
        Rotate a vector in Cartesian space.
        Parameters:
        x - the x value of the vector
        y - the y value of the vector
        angle - the angle to rotate
        Returns:
        the vector of x and y values
